Html: I'm starting with Prism, and I did the Hello World howto, and I also followed the View Injection quickstart.  Is there an order to follow the How To under Development Activities or the Quickstarts so one can start with the Hello World, and follow along, until they have the Stock Trader RI?

Hi

 

There is not a particular order in which the documentation should be read. However I will provide my personal opinion about it. Depending on what you are trying to achieve the order will probably vary. Since mixing documentation with code is usually the thing that works the most for me, I would try to get to understand the different topics while checking how each of them is coded, and then put the different pieces together.

 

You can check the order from the Composite Application Guidance for WPF book (based in the Prism-v1 documentation). In my personal opinion, reading the technical concepts before going into the Reference Implementation might be useful to understand the RI better.

 

Please let me know if this helps.

 

Damian Schenkelman

http://blogs.southworks.net/dschenkelman
